thread.title: Reports: Amaro to join Sox
thread.title_full: Reports: Amaro to join Sox | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Reports: Amaro to join Sox
text:
Reports: Amaro to join Sox Herald Staff Sunday, October 25, 2015 comments Tweet According to several reports, ex-Philadelphia Phillies general manager Ruben Amaro Jr. will join the Red Sox as the team’s new first base coach, replacing Arnie Beyler, who was fired at the end of the season.
CBS Sports MLB Insider Jon Heyman reported yesterday that the move is not yet official, but the Red Sox are expected to make an announcement soon.
Amaro, 50, has expressed an interest in managing at the big league level.
He’s a former reserve outfielder who retired in 1998 and joined the Phillies front office, working his way up until he was named general manager after Philadelphia’s 2008 championship season. In September, new president of baseball operations Andy MacPhail announced the team would not renew his contract.
